stimulusHtml: A satellite is in an elliptical orbit around a planet, as shown in the figure. Which of the following statements best justifies why the satellite's kinetic energy changes as it orbits the planet?
choicesHtml: The satellite’s angular momentum has a nonzero magnitude.
The satellite’s angular momentum has the same direction throughout the orbit.
The gravitational force exerted on the satellite by the planet does work on the satellite.
The gravitational forces that the satellite and the planet exert on each other are opposite in direction.
